data.text:
Here are the justices’ 2020, 2021, 2022 and 2023 events; prior years’ events were largely covered by SCOTUSMap

Future events and appearances

91. Justice Jackson is scheduled to give a book talk at Harlem’s Apollo Theater (9/3): Announcement

92. Justice Jackson is scheduled to give a book talk at the Kennedy Center (9/4): Announcement

93. Justice Jackson is scheduled to give a book talk at Atlanta Symphony Hall (9/5): Announcement

94. Justice Jackson is scheduled to give a book talk at the Adrienne Arsht Center in Miami (9/7): Announcement

95. Justice Jackson is scheduled to give a book talk at Benaroya Hall in Seattle (9/9): Announcement

96. Justice Jackson is scheduled to give a book talk at the Sydney Goldstein Theater in San Francisco (9/10): Announcement

97. Justice Jackson is scheduled to give a book talk at Harvard University’s Sanders Theatre (9/12): Announcement

98. Justice Jackson is scheduled to give a book talk at the Chicago Humanities Festival (9/15): Announcement

99. Justice Jackson is scheduled to give a book talk at the Wilshire Ebell Theatre in Los Angeles (9/17): Announcement

100. Justice Jackson is scheduled to give a book talk with Librarian of Congress Carla Hayden at the MLK Library in D.C. (9/19): Announcement

101. Justice Jackson is scheduled to give a book talk during the Atlantic Ideas Festival in D.C. (9/20): Schedule

102. Justice Jackson is scheduled to give a book talk at Enoch Pratt Free Library in Baltimore (9/21): Announcement

103. Justice Jackson is scheduled to give a book talk at the African American History and Culture Museum in D.C. (9/24) Announcement

104. Justice Jackson is scheduled to give a book talk at Enon Tabernacle Baptist Church in Philadelphia (9/28): Announcement

105. Justice Breyer (ret.) is expected to be a guest on Yale Law Prof. Akhil Amar’s podcast (Sept. TBD)

106. Justice Jackson is scheduled to give a book talk at the ChIPs (“Chiefs in Intellectual Property”) 2024 Global Summit in D.C. (10/17): Announcement

107. Justice Sotomayor is scheduled to accept Brandeis School of Law’s Brandeis Medal in Louisville, Ky. (2/5/25): Article

Past events and appearances

90. Justice Gorsuch is interviewed in the Supreme Court by Margaret Hoover for PBS’s “Firing Line” (aired 8/16): Video

89. Justice Jackson appears to be vacationing in Martha’s Vineyard with college friends (8/11): Photos

88. Justice Gorsuch is interviewed in his chambers by Ben Shapiro on his eponymous show (aired 8/11): Video

87. Justice Gorsuch gives a book talk at the Nixon Presidential Library in Yorba Linda, Calif. (8/9): Video

86. Justice Gorsuch gives a book talk at the Reagan Presidential Library in Simi Valley, Calif. (8/8): Video

85. Justice Gorsuch is interviewed in his chambers by Megyn Kelly on her eponymous SiriusXM show (8/6): Video

84. Justice Gorsuch is interviewed in the Supreme Court by Sandra Smith for Fox News’ “America Reports” (8/6): Video

83. Justice Gorsuch is interviewed remotely (in a different D.C. studio) by Fox News’ Ainsley Earhardt on “Fox & Friends” (8/6): Video

82. Justice Gorsuch is interviewed in his chambers by Hugh Hewitt on his eponymous podcast (8/5): Video

81. Justice Gorsuch is interviewed in the Supreme Court by CBS News’ Major Garrett (aired 8/5): Video

80. Justice Gorsuch is interviewed in the Supreme Court by Fox News’ Shannon Bream (aired 8/4): Video

79. Justice Breyer (ret.) speaks at the College of the Atlantic Summer Institute in Bar Harbor, Maine (8/1): Announcement

78. Justice Gorsuch is interviewed in his chambers by the Kyle Peterson of the Wall Street Journal editorial board (around 7/31): Article

77. Justice Gorsuch is interviewed by phone by the Atlantic’s Rebecca Rosen (around 7/31): Article

76. Justice Gorsuch is interviewed in his chambers by the David French for the New York Times (7/31): Article

75. Justice Gorsuch is interviewed in his chambers by the Associated Press’ Mark Sherman (7/29): Article

74. Justice Kagan speaks at the Ninth Circuit Judicial Conference in Sacramento (7/25): Video

73. Justice Breyer (ret.) speaks with the New Yorker’s Evan Osnos at the Sun Valley Writers’ Conference (7/22): Schedule

72. Justice Breyer (ret.) speaks with the National Constitution Center’s Jeffrey Rosen at the Sun Valley Writers’ Conference (7/21): Schedule

71. Justice Gorsuch teaches a class on the separation of powers at Scalia Law’s National Security Institute in Porto, Portugal (7/15-26): Announcement

70. Chief Justice Roberts teaches a class on Supreme Court history in Galway, Ireland, for New England Law Boston (early to mid-July but exact dates unclear): Announcement

69. Justice Breyer (ret.) reads the Declaration of Independence at the Plainfield, N.H., Town Hall (7/4): Tweet (no video)

68. Justice Breyer (ret.) speaks with GW Law Associate Dean Alan Morrison at George Washington University (6/12): Video

67. Justice Breyer (ret.) speaks with several law professors at the Brookings Institution in Washington (6/5): Video

66. Justice Jackson hosts dinner for an unknown number of guests at the Supreme Court: Instagram post (no video)

65. Chief Justice Roberts, Justice Alito and Jackson attend the Supreme Court Historical Society’s 50th anniversary gala in the Court’s Great Hall (6/3): Article (no video)

64. Justice Breyer (ret.) speaks about his new book with Prof. Jessica Levinson in a Live Talks Los Angeles event at the Glorya Kaufman Performing Arts Center at Vista Del Mar (5/28): Video

63. Justice Sotomayor speaks at Radcliffe Institute at Harvard University and receives the Radcliffe Medal (5/24): Article (no video)

62. Justice Breyer (ret.) speaks about his new book with The Dispatch‘s Sarah Isgur at the Sydney Goldstein Theater in San Francisco (5/22): Audio (no video)

61. Justice Jackson and the Supreme Court Historical Society host a conversation in the SCOTUS courtroom with Judge Richard Gergel to talk about his book, Unexampled Courage: The Blinding of Sgt. Isaac Woodard and the Awakening of President Harry S. Truman and Judge J. Waties Waring (5/21): Video

60. Justice Gorsuch speaks at the 25th annual Burton Awards honoring legal writing in Washington (5/20): Article (no video)

59. Justice Jackson receives an honorary doctorate at Spelman College in Atlanta (5/19): Video (starts at 1:37:17)

58. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed by Joie Chen on “Matter of Face with Soledad O’Brien” (5/18): Video

57. Justices Kavanaugh, Barrett and Jackson competed in the ACLI Capital Challenge, a three-mile race in Washington (5/15): Article (no video)

56. Chief Justice Roberts speaks at the Federal Circuit judicial conference in Washington (5/14): Article (no video)

55. Justice Breyer (ret.) speaks with GW Law Prof. Alan Morrison at a GW Law event in Washington (5/13): Video

54. Chief Justice Roberts and Jane Roberts attend a book party for Justice Breyer’s (ret.) new book hosted by Kate Lehrer and Walter and Ann Pincus (5/12): Article (no video)

53. Justice Alito gives the commencement address at the Franciscan University of Steubenville (Ohio) (5/11): Video

52. Justice Thomas speaks at the Eleventh Circuit judicial conference in Point Clear, Ala. (5/10): Article (no video)

51. Justice Kavanaugh speaks at the Fifth Circuit judicial conference in Austin, Tex. (5/10): Article (no video)

50. Justice Sotomayor speaks virtually to a New York State Bar Association event on civics education at the Bar Center in Albany (5/9): Article (no video)

49. Justice Breyer (ret.) speaks with Dan Abrams about his new book at Temple Emanu-el’s Streicker Center in Manhattan (5/8): Announcement (no video)

48. Justice Breyer (ret.) speaks with Emily Bazelon about his new book at the John Jay Homestead in Katonah, N.Y. (5/7): Announcement (no video)

47. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed by Devin Dwyer for ABC News in Washington (5/1): Video

46. Justice Kavanaugh introduces a Supreme Court Historical Society event on Bushrod Washington in the SCOTUS courtroom (5/1): Video

45. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed by Shannon Bream for Fox News Sunday (4/28): Video

44. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed in his Supreme Court chambers by Stefania Palma of the Financial Times (4/24): Article (no video)

43. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed for WBUR’s “On Point” (4/24) in either Washington or Boston: Audio (no video)

42. Chief Justice Roberts and Justices Kagan and Kavanaugh attend the 25th anniversary celebration of Georgetown Law’s Supreme Court Institute on the law school campus (4/24): Press report (no video)

41. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed by NBC News’ Andrea Mitchell on “Mitchell Reports” in Washington, D.C. (4/23): Video

40. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed by ABC News’ Jonathan Karl for “This Week” in Washington, D.C. (4/21): Video

39. Justice Breyer (ret.) speaks at the Springfield (Mass.) Public Forum at Springfield Symphony Hall (4/11): Announcement (no video)

38. Chief Justice Roberts participates in the Legal Services Corporation’s 50th anniversary celebration at the Omni Shoreham H0tel in Washington (4/9): Video

37. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed by attorney Tali Farhadian Weinstein at Central Synagogue in Manhattan (4/8): Video

36. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed by James Carville and Al Hunt on their podcast, “Politics War Room” (4/4): Audio (no video)

35. Chief Justice Roberts delivers remarks at Duke Law School honoring the late Justice Sandra Day O’Connor, who was presented with the Bolch Prize for the Rule of Law posthumously (4/4): Video

34. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed by law student Ibrain Hernández Rangel for Este Pais and SCOTUSblog (4/3): Article (no video)

33. Justice Sotomayor attends the celebration of E.D.N.Y. Judge Leo Glasser’s 100th birthday at the federal courthouse in Brooklyn (4/3): Tweet (no video)

32. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed by author Walter Isaacson on PBS’s “Amanpour & Co.” remotely from Cambridge, Mass. (4/2): Video

31. Justice Jackson meets with Birgitta Tazelaar, ambassador of the Netherlands to the U.S., in her Supreme Court chambers (4/1, 2 or 3): No video, but mentioned in this video

30. Justice Breyer (ret.) is in conversation with CNN’s Joan Biskupic as part of the Chicago Humanities Festival: Announcement (no video)

29. Justice Jackson meets with UVA Law students in the Supreme Court building (late March): Press release (no video)

28. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed by National Constitution Center CEO Jeffrey Rosen at the Center in Philadelphia (3/28): Video

27. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed by NPR’s Nina Totenberg at the Freer Gallery of Art’s Meyer Auditorium in the National Museum of Asian Art in D.C. (3/27): Announcement (no video)

26. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed by CNN’s Wolf Blitzer in D.C. (3/27): Video

25. Justice Breyer (ret.) delivers the annual Robert B. Silvers lecture at the New York Public Library (3/26): Video

24. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed by Washington Post columnist Ruth Marcus in a Washington Post Live conversation (3/26): Video

23. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed by Ankush Khardori for POLITICO Magazine (interview ran 3/26; likely took place the previous week): Article (no video)

22. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed by Stephen Colbert on CBS’s “Late Show” in New York (3/25): Video 1 and video 2

21. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed by PBS NewsHour’s Amna Nawaz for “NewsHour” (3/25): Video

20. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed on MSNBC’s “Morning Joe” (3/25): Video

19. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed by Temple Law’s Randy Maniloff for ABA Journal (interview ran 3/25; likely took place the previous week): Article (no video)

18. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed by CBS News’ Jan Crawford for “CBS This Morning” (aired 3/25; taped the previous week): Video

17. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed by NBC News’ Kristen Welker for “Meet the Press” (aired 3/24; taped the previous week): Video

16. Justice Jackson is inducted as an Honorary Life Fellow of the Foundation of the Federal Bar Association in a ceremony at the Supreme Court (3/22): Social media post (no video)

15. Justices Sotomayor and Barrett are interviewed at George Washington University by Eric Liu, the chief executive of Citizen University, during a Civic Learning Week National Forum hosted by iCivics (3/12): Video

14. Chief Justice Roberts and Justices Sotomayor, Kagan, Gorsuch, Kavanaugh, Jackson and Kennedy (ret.) attend the State of the Union Address (3/7): Picture and press report

13. Justice Jackson is presented with the American Voice Award by Arena Stage as part of the Opening Night celebration for the world premiere of Kia Corthron’s play “Tempestuous Elements” (2/24): Press release and pictures (no video)

12. Justices Sotomayor and Barrett speak at the National Governors Association’s Winter Meeting in Washington as a part of Utah Gov. Spencer Cox’s “Disagree Better” initiative (2/23): Video

11. Justice Breyer (ret.) is interviewed in the Supreme Court building by the N.Y. Times’ Adam Liptak (late Feb., likely 2/22 or 2/29): Press report (no video)

10. Justice Kagan speaks at the Library of Congress with Sixth Circuit Chief Judge Jeff Sutton (2/8): Video

9. Justice Sotomayor speaks at the University of Hawaii’s Richardson School of Law with Prof. Kamaile Turcan (1/31): Video

8. Justice Sotomayor speaks at Berkeley Law with Dean Erwin Chemerinsky (1/29): Video

7. Justice Breyer (ret.) speaks at the swearing in of his former law clerk, Bessie Dewar, as a justice on the Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court (1/29): Video

6. Justice Sotomayor speaks at the ITSE training center before 600 public school students and participants in U.S. embassy youth programs (1/25): Press release and highlights video

5. Justice Sotomayor and U.S. Ambassador to Panama Mari Carmen Aponte speak with law students at the Instituto Técnico Superior Especializado (ITSE) in Panama City (1/25): Press release and highlights video

4. Justice Sotomayor and U.S. Ambassador to Panama Mari Carmen Aponte speak with former State Department officials at the Panama America Center in Panama City (1/25): Highlights video

3. Justice Sotomayor speaks with President of Panama’s Supreme Court of Justice, María Eugenia López Arias, at Santa María la Antigua University in Panama City (1/24): Video and photos

2. Justice Jackson and her husband attend an Institute for Education dinner in Washington, D.C. (1/23): Photos
